thread.title: Making Strides Against Breast Cancer
thread.title_full: Making Strides Against Breast Cancer - KCTV5

author: Dave Eckert, Assignment Editor
title: Making Strides Against Breast Cancer
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Thousands of people flooded The Crossroads Saturday to "Make Strides Against Breast Cancer."
They laced up their shoes and put their pink on for the early morning charity event, a money-raising walk to help in the fight against breast cancer.
"Wanted to give a great big round of applause for all breast cancer survivors," said host and KCTV5 anchor Carolyn Long.
"Either they've lost someone to this horrible disease, or they're fighting it now, or they're a survivor and they're hoping to stay that way. It's just very touching," Long added.
The American Cancer Society's Making Strides Against Breast Cancer raises much-needed money for support services and ground-breaking research for patients like Ashley Linder's aunt.
"My aunt was diagnosed with cancer just a couple of weeks ago and had surgery for the first time," Linder said.
Everyone here, it seemed, had a person to support and a reason to come.
An estimated 14,000 people turned out for today's event.
